subject: Re: Viewing the LWYT pages on a mobile phone
preview: Hi Jessica,    You sure can, just don't schedule any social blasts or eDM's etc until later in the week as you will want a couple of days up your sleeve for the 'just in case' or 'how about' changes.

full_threads.body:
Hi Jessica, 


You sure can, just don't schedule any social blasts or eDM's etc until later in the week as you will want a couple of days up your sleeve for the 'just in case' or 'how about' changes. Seems really obvious to say, but just being super careful. 


Thanks and speak soon,

Hi Heath - we'll work until noon tomorrow and then hold off until Monday. Just to confirm: we can advise our partners that the website will be live on Monday?


Jessica Younan


National Marketing & Communications Manager


Transplant Australia Ltd


M: 0401 206 402


P: 02 9922 5400


www.transplant.org.au
Re: Viewing the LWYT pages on a mobile phone
Re: Viewing the LWYT pages on a mobile phone

Hi Jessica, 


We have brought across the news articles, you will need do the images like last time. The button in the footer is now also set to open in new tab. 


So far as going live, we will need some time to run some updates and ready the site. At a push we can do this over the weekend. If this suits you, it will more than likely be done on Sunday afternoon/evening. There will be little to no downtime. 


I will also request that no changes are made after noon tomorrow as we will start our prep from then on and the staging site will be somewhat unusable during this time.


Let me know? Thanks,
Re: Viewing the LWYT pages on a mobile phone
Re: Viewing the LWYT pages on a mobile phone

Hi Heath – we want to go live with this tomorrow. Can you please let us know how you go with the roll-over?


Also: when you click this button it takes us away from the Transplant Australia site. We want this to open in a new tab – not take ppl away from our site. Can you please amend?


Jessica Younan


National Marketing & Communications Manager


Transplant Australia Ltd


M: 0401 206 402


P: 02 9922 5400


Suite 302, 10 Help Street,


Chatswood NSW 2067 Australia.


www.transplant.org.au

Hi Chandana, 


We have updated items 1 and 2 for you. 


Thanks and speak soon,
Joel Maligalig thanks!
Heath Maguire  All done on the mobile popup thingy. Cheers!
Re: Viewing the LWYT pages on a mobile phone

Hi Heath – in addition to Chandana’s email below, can you please do another roll-over of the news stories? I’ve limited posts as much as I was able, but we’ve still had to publish multiple news stories since you did your last crossover.


https://transplant.org.au/news/


Jessica Younan


National Marketing & Communications Manager


Transplant Australia Ltd


M: 0401 206 402


P: 02 9922 5400


Suite 302, 10 Help Street,


Chatswood NSW 2067 Australia.


www.transplant.org.au


From: Chandana Guha
Sent: Tuesday, 3 July 2018 5:36 PM
To: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Cc: Jessica Younan <jessica.younan@transplant.org.au>; Support - WP Perk <support@wpperk.com>
Subject: RE: Viewing the LWYT pages on a mobile phone


Hi Heath,


We are aiming to go live this week. Please could you help us with the below by Thursday at the latest?




  1. http://transplantaus.wpengine.com/living-with-your-transplant/support/assistance-schemes/ - although the hotspots open up on my mobile, I am unable to open up the links.

  2. The footer in each page which reads “Are you registered as an organ donor? Click here… needs to open up to the link : https://register.donatelife.gov.au/decide


The links on the experts page work well on a mobile. Nothing more to be done on that page.


Many thanks for your help.


Kindest


Chandana


From: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Sent: Tuesday, 26 June 2018 5:33 PM
To: Chandana Guha <chandana@transplant.org.au>
Cc: Jessica Younan <jessica.younan@transplant.org.au>; Support - WP Perk <support@wpperk.com>
Subject: Re: Viewing the LWYT pages on a mobile phone


Hi Chandana,


The below updates have been made. We haven’t done much work the Experts Behind the Program test page as you mentioned you were still working on it.


Let me know how it goes?


Thanks and speak soon,HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AUE. heath@wolfiq.com.au | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271
Re: Viewing the LWYT pages on a mobile phone

Joel Maligalig on this page: http://transplantaus.wpengine.com/living-with-your-transplant/support/assistance-schemes/ when on mobile and you click on the links in the hot spot popups they don't work... I'm thinking it's a z-index thing ? Can you please look into it, I have done the other task. Thanks!!

We are aiming to go live this week. Please could you help us with the below by Thursday at the latest?




  1. http://transplantaus.wpengine.com/living-with-your-transplant/support/assistance-schemes/ - although the hotspots open up on my mobile, I am unable to open up the links.

The links on the experts page work well on a mobile. Nothing more to be done on that page.

Chandana

On 26 Jun 2018, at 11:59 am, Chandana Guha <chandana@transplant.org.au> wrote:


Hi Heath,

Hope you are well.

Just wondering if there have been any progress on the below issues?

Kindest

Chandana

From: Chandana Guha
Sent: Tuesday, 19 June 2018 4:32 PM
To: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Subject: Viewing the LWYT pages on a mobile phone

Hi Heath,

Hope you are well.

We are checking compatibility of the LWYT pages with a mobile phone screen. Most of the pages display nicely on a phone screen except the images with hotspots. Are you able to help us with this?

Here are the links to the pages

  1. http://transplantaus.wpengine.com/living-with-your-transplant/support/assistance-schemes/
  2. https://transplantaus.wpengine.com/living-with-your-transplant/experts-behind-program-test/ (this page isn’t ready yet, we are trying see if this layout works on the mobile. We will finalise the layout if you confirm that the hotspots will be mobile friendly)
  3. This isn’t a hotspot issue - Here the menus don’t align evenly on the mob screen.

https://transplantaus.wpengine.com/living-with-your-transplant/

<image003.jpg>

Kindest

Chandana
